title: ABL Space exits commercial launch market, shifts focus to missile defense
summary: ‘We have made the decision to focus our efforts on national defense, and specifically on missile defense technologies’

title: To lead the next wave of space-based radar, U.S. must learn from GPS success
summary: Forty years ago, the United States government made a decision that transformed the modern world: it opened the Global Positioning System (GPS) to civilian use. What began as a military […]

title: Foust Forward | Is there a business case for the moon?
summary: Enough commercial activity is heading to the moon in the next few months to create a traffic jam. Firefly Aerospace, ispace and Intuitive Machines are all launching commercial lunar lander […]

title: Impulse Space buys three Falcon 9 launches
summary: Impulse Space has purchased three Falcon 9 launches for its Helios transfer vehicle for missions starting in 2026, including one for the Space Force.

title: Hubble Takes a Look at Tangled Galaxies
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image depicts the cosmic tangle that is MCG+05-31-045, a pair of interacting galaxies located 390 million light-years away and a part of the Coma galaxy cluster. The Coma Cluster is a particularly rich cluster that contains over a thousand known galaxies. Amateur astronomers can easily spot several of these in […]

title: Earth from Space: Clouds or snow?
summary: These two images acquired by Copernicus Sentinel-2 highlight how the mission can help distinguish between clouds and snow.

title: ESA Releases Findings of Super Heavy-Lift Rocket Studies
summary: The European Space Agency has revealed the findings of a pair of studies it commissioned to explore how Europe could develop a rocket capable of delivering 100 tonnes to low Earth orbit. In June 2022, the European Space Agency (ESA) published a call for its PROTEIN (Preparatory Activities for European Heavy Lift Launcher) initiative. The […]

title: AST SpaceMobile leans on Blue Origin to ramp up satellite launches
summary: AST SpaceMobile said Nov. 14 it has booked rockets from Blue Origin and others to deploy enough satellites between 2025 and 2026 to provide full text, voice, and 5G data services to standard mobile phones across the United States and other key markets.

title: Aging and Fragility Biomarkers are Altered by Spaceflight
summary: Spaceflight accelerates the symptoms of aging in astronaut bodies by inducing genomic instability, mitochondrial dysfunction, and increased inflammation. This is the first study to comprehensively examine biomarkers and pathways associated with spaceflight and terrestrial aging, frailty, and sarcopenia. Main Findings: Impact: This work reveals the need for a frailty index to monitor development of frailty-related […]
